It is an initiative of the World Federation for Mental Health celebrated in more than 100 countries.
One of its objectives is to raise awareness about the importance of mental health, raise awareness among the population and create strategies for its timely detection and care.

tweet_objects.text: _paya_kun: 気持ちが疲れている人は「疲れは遅れてやってくる」という言葉を覚えておいてください。旅行や引っ越し、転職などの大きなイベントをやった後に、気が抜けるとドーンと疲れがやってきます。「よくわからないけど疲れてる」はたぶん遅れてやってきてる疲れです。
tweet_objects.text_in_english: _paya_kun: If you are feeling tired, please remember the saying, ``Tiredness comes later.'' After a big event such as traveling, moving, or changing jobs, if you let your guard down, you'll start to feel tired. ``I don't know but I'm tired'' is probably a delayed feeling of tiredness.

tweet_objects.text_in_english: _mochi: It's not widely known, but the brain can actually become inflamed. No matter how much you rest, the reason why you can't recover from fatigue is not because your body is tired, but because your brain is tired. Inflammation causes brain sensors to malfunction, causing chronic fatigue. Recent studies have also shown that it is involved in the pathology of depression and many mental illnesses. You can try it right away...

tweet_objects.text_in_english: _: I heard from a doctor that ``It's better not to do anything when you're tired.'' When you're feeling mentally tired, it's a good idea to close your eyes, block out the sounds, and don't think about anything for 5 to 10 minutes. Yesterday, I was feeling mentally tired for the first time in a while, so I tried it right away, and my mind and body were both less tired, so I decided to give it a try...
